meanings.sent1: She had a concentrated look on her face as she solved the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The juice was very concentrated, so we added water to dilute it.
meanings.sent3: The cat's concentrated stare at the toy mouse was both cute and intense.
meanings.sent4: The city's population was concentrated in the downtown area, bustling with activity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's concentrated effort helped the students understand the difficult concept.

meanings.definition: To bring all efforts or resources to bear on a particular task or objective
meanings.sent1: The team concentrated their energy on winning the championship.
meanings.sent2: She concentrated on finishing her homework before going out to play.
meanings.sent3: The chef concentrated on creating the perfect dish, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent4: The students concentrated their study time on preparing for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The workers concentrated their efforts on completing the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: To increase the strength or purity of a substance by removing or reducing the diluting agent
meanings.sent1: The distillation process concentrated the alcohol in the solution.
meanings.sent2: The company concentrated the flavor of the sauce by reducing the water content.
meanings.sent3: The scientist concentrated the sample to analyze its components more effectively.
meanings.sent4: The chef concentrated the broth to enhance its taste and aroma.
meanings.sent5: The medication was concentrated to make it more potent and effective.
